question: Aadhaar-Linked Birth Registration (ALBR) scheme has been launched in which of the following states?
explanation: Aadhaar-Linked Birth Registration (ALBR) has been launched in Haryana, Chandigarh and Himachal Pradesh. Under this scheme, staff members of hospitals are trained to work as Aadhaar operators. They have been provided with tablets to cover all newborn babies. For newborns, biometric update will be done on attaining the age of 5 years and 15 years. Under the scheme, 475 kits and 890 tablets were provided to Haryana, 165 kits, 50 biometric kits and 800 tablets to Himachal Pradesh, 8 kits and 33 tablets to Chandigarh.
